title: I'm having Major issues with recording league with fraps
body:
Hi, I recently brought fraps and I've been having troubles with it recording league (and only league)

When I go into game and start fraps it works fine recording at 120 fps like its supposed to, but after about 2 minutes i start getting severe fps drops that have major effects on my performance in game, the fps drops range from 120-40 or even 120-20 

My fraps settings:
Benchmark settings: fps (ticked)

Video capture settings: 120 fps, half size

League settings:

 Very high and vsync is off

Computer Specs:

GPU: AMD Radeon R9 280X 3gb

CPU: Intel Core i5-4460

Hard Drive Seagate Desktop SSHD 1TB


Please try to help my problem it would be much appreciated.

replies.body:
I would suggest opening up your resource monitor while you are running them both in tandem (you can get to it via task manager it is one of the tabs)

Have a look what is chewing up your resources.

I would also suggest setting your league to be border less

Hi, I tired it and on the cpu tab of resource monitor is says league is using an average of 10 (which I presume means 10%) and fraps as an average of 10  these two do jump up to fraps being 30 and league being 15 but only for a few seconds, nothing else is larger than these 2 processes, and i did change my league to borderless but I didn't notice any difference in the fps drops, thanks for trying though, really appreciated :D
Did you have a look at what your RAM is doing?

Yeah i just looked and the most memory is being used by League of Legends.exe, LOL client.exe, svchost.exe (localsystemnetworkrestricted), Skype.exe, fraps.exe, and 4 chrome.exe's (in order from highest to lowest) all together it says 50% of total memory is being used.

Well if that's the case I am a little confused O.o

Have you tried to record a different game as a test?
Yeah, ive try'd payday 2 and cod advanced warfare and i dont suffer from any fps drops when recording with those games idk why its just league
